original: LARSSON, Lennart Fredrik Laurentius, Grosshandlare, Stockholm, f Sdsv 19/6 80 av grhdl Axel L o Ida Sundberg. Schartaus 98, kommers stud Tyskl o USA 00—02. Köpm Sthlm sed. 05, vkst dir AB The Swedish Tra-ding Co sed. 25. Hdlssakk v leg Washington 14—15, adj led stat livsmed.kommiss 15, led FHK o förest hdlsavd 17—19, flm Sthlms hdlskamm 23, verkst utsk 41, Sthlms städs sjukhusstyr 22—26, upphandl.deleg f Sthlms stads sjukh 22—26. Styr.led AB Sv Shell, Sv radioAB. RNO, RVO, RFinlVROlkl.
translated: LARSSON, Lennart Fredrik Laurentius, Merchant, Stockholm, born in Sundsvall on June 19, 1880, son of Axel L and Ida Sundberg. Attended Schartaus Business School in 1898, studied commerce in Germany and the USA from 1900 to 1902. Became a merchant in Stockholm in 1905 and served as a Managing Director of the Swedish Trading Company from 1925. Participated in trade negotiations in Washington in 1914-1915, served as an assistant to the State Food Commission in 1915, and was a member of the Federation of Merchants and the Head of the Trade Department from 1917 to 1919. Joined the board of the Stockholm Chamber of Commerce in 1923 and the Executive Committee in 1941. Served on the board of directors of the Stockholm City Hospital from 1922 to 1926 and as a procurement delegate for the hospital during the same period. Also served on the boards of AB Swedish Shell and AB Swedish Radio. Received the Royal Norwegian Order, the Royal Victorian Order, and the Finnish Order of the Lion, among others.

education.institution: Study of Commerce in the USA

career.workplace: Föreningen för Handelns och Kommunernas Samsyn

career.occupational_title: Board Member, Stockholm Chamber of Commerce
